task.title: Merge release into develop
task.description: After merging release branch to master, you should merge it into develop too. And then, push to an upstream branch. But sometimes push fails. It happens if there are some changes on the remote that you don't have.

steps.description: Return to develop
Merge release/0.2.0 to develop without fastforward
Try to push commits to upstream
Looks like you cannot push cleanly. Remove last merge commit
Download changes from origin
Try again to merge release/0.2.0 to develop without fastforward
Push commits to upstream

task.title: Make first release
task.description: Your project is starting to look good. It is time to make first release. But first you have to fix some typos.

steps.description: Create branch release/0.1.0 and checkout in one step
Stage your modifications
Commit new files with message "Fix typo"

task.title: Merge release
task.description: Let's merge our release into master, tag it, and push to remote to share it with the world. You should also merge your release branch into develop.

steps.description: Return to master
Merge release/0.1.0 to master without fastforward
Mark this commit with an annotated tag 0.10
Push commits to branch master of origin and tell git that your local branch master should track it
Return to develop
Merge release/0.1.0 to develop without fastforward
Push commits to upstream

task.title: Add dialogs to your page
task.description: You just did your first release but it doesn't mean the work is over. Add dialogs to your page. Start working on a new feature and share your work, so others can collaborate.

steps.description: Create branch feature/dialog and checkout in one step
Add new files to index
Commit new files with message "Add dialog template"
Now push your branch to origin with setting the newly created remote branch as an upsteram branch

task.title: Oh no! Title margin needs fixing
task.description: Looks like you have to stop working on your dialogs, there is something to fix on a master branch. Switch back to it, create a hotfix branch and fix what needs fixing.

steps.description: Return to master
Create branch hotfix/title-margin and checkout in one step
After modifying the title margin you need to add changed files to staging area.
Commit changes with message "Change title margin"

task.title: Merge hotfix to master
task.description: Phew, looks like you saved the day and successfully fixed margin. Merge it into master and tag as 0.1.1. And in the end, push it to origin.

steps.description: Switch back to master
Merge hotfix/title-margin to master without fastforward
Mark this commit with a tag 0.1.1
Push it to origin

task.title: Start project
task.description: At first you have to create a new Git repository and tell Git, which project files you want to track.

steps.description: Initialize repo in your current directory
Add all files from your working directory to index (staging area)
You added a new file notes.txt. Stage it.
It is time to make a first commit! Create one with message "Init project".

task.title: Describe your project
task.description: This is a good habit to create a file describing your project called README.

steps.description: Start tracking your new file README.txt
Commit adding the file with message "Add readme"

task.title: Do some work
task.description: You were working for some time, and decided to take a snapshot of your project to record it's current state.

steps.description: Add only files from your src folder. (Tip: you can use "*" in your command)
You just remembered to fix something and modified src/app.css, stage it again to have the most recent version in your index
Now commit your work with message "Do some improvements"

task.title: Development branch
task.description:
I's a good idea to do your work on a dedicated branches. It helps to keep the history of a project well-formed, and therefore easier to browse and analyze.
Let's create a branch for development.

steps.description: Create a new branch called "develop"
Switch to created branch

task.title: Add menu bar
task.description: When you start working on a new functionality, you should create brand new branch for it. Do some work on a dedicated branch to implement menu bar for your project.

steps.description: Create and checkout to branch feature/menu in one step
After implementing a menu component add new files to index
Commit new files with message "Add menu list"
Now, when the menu animation is ready, stage all files
Commit with message "Add menu item animation"

task.title: Merge menu to branch develop
task.description: You finished working on a menu. As it is ready, you can now include it in your development branch.

steps.description: Return to branch develop
Merge branch feature/menu to develop without fastforward

task.title: Create header of your page
task.description:
You finished menu and included it to your main development branch. But your page is still rather empty.
Let's create a header. It's best to do it on another topic branch dedicated especially for this feature.

steps.description: Checkout to a new branch feature/header
You did some work and created a header container. Stage all files.
Commit new files with message "Add header container"
Stage new files and changes
Commit new files and changes with message "Add logo image"

task.title: Merge header to develop branch
task.description: Let's say you think you finished working on a header. You merge it into develop, and realize, there is one more thing to do to complete header. Revert that merge, do some changes and then merge again.

steps.description: Switch to branch develop
Merge feature/header to develop without fastforward
You realized header is not ready yet. Remove last merge commit
Return to branch feature/header
You added a page title and removed headerTemp.js, so now stage all changes
Commit new files with message "Add page title"
Switch back to develop
Merge header branch again (without fastforward)

task.title: Add remote repository
task.description: So far all your git operations where local. You can add a remote repo to synchronize with. This way you can share your work and collaborate on a project with everyone who has access to that remote repository.

steps.description: Add a remote repository from https://github.com/johny/project.git and name it origin
Pull data from remote branch develop
Remote repository doesn't have any commits you don't have. Push your changes to it.

task.title: Add content to your page
task.description: Okay, you have to eventually deal with content of your page. You know what to do - switch to a dedicated branch, do some work and commit it.

steps.description: Create branch feature/content and checkout in one step
You just finished implementing content container. Stage all your files
Commit new files with message "Add content container"
After adjusting scrollbar you have to add your changes to index
Create a commit with message "Adjust scrollbar"

task.title: Merge content to develop branch
task.description: You have to merge content into develop. But you're no longer working alone. There is a shared version of your project on a remote and you want to synchronize with it. You need to check, if anyone hasn't pushed something to develop before you.

steps.description: Return to develop
Download changes from remote branch develop from origin
Merge feature/content to develop without fastforward
Push your changes and set remote branch develop from origin as an upstream branch for your local develop branch

task.title: Merge hotfix to develop
task.description: Okay, so you just merged your hotfix branch to master and pushed it to remote. Let's do the same with branch develop - merge hotfix into it and push it.

steps.description: Switch to develop
Merge hotfix/title-margin to develop without fastforward
Pull from remote branch develop
Now you can push it upstream

task.title: Another release
task.description: You should make another release. Switch to a new dedicated branch, add a version.txt file, then merge into master and push to origin.

steps.description: Create branch release/0.2.0 and checkout in one step
Stage newly added file version.txt
Commit adding a new file with message "Add version file"
Switch to master
Merge release/0.2.0 to master without fastforward
Create an annotated tag 0.2.0 -m "Second release"
Push to origin

task.title: Finish dialogs
task.description: Now, when the situation is under control, you can finish working on dialogs. Switch to feature branch, make last changes and commit them. Lastly, merge it into develop and push to an upstream branch.

steps.description: Switch back to branch feature/dialog
Chcek if there are any commits on an upstream branch that you dont have and merge them in
After making final improvements, stage modified files
Commit with "Improve dialog template"
Return to develop
Merge feature/dialog to develop without fastforward
